column4: I cant sign in to ubuntu, unless its in failsafe gnome. What can I do to log in normal mode, Itype in the username and password and the screen restarts to the login
do you get any errors?
genii, heh, don't use ls like that .. infact ls there is not even needed
sudo chown -R George:George /home/George
see what i just said up there ^^
find ~ -iname ".*" -exec chown -R $USER.$USER {} \+
does it set the permission on other directories?
yes .. but that's going offtopic
so, what's not allowing you to set those permissions and run the file?
where did you save/put the file?
then.  cd ~/Desktop;  chmod +x file.bin;  ./file.bin
do you install codecs manually??
yes
that's a bit harsh on yourself - but sure, there are plenty of ways to !backup
how do u install all the codecs needed? sounds like im working to hard, lol.

I generally use the w32codecs package from medibuntu - it has a majority of the popular codecs (if not all of them) -- on systems where w32codecs is not available I use the mplayer codec pack (which essentially has the same codecs)
http://www.mplayerhq.hu/MPlayer/releases/codecs/
can i find that in my applications?
i'm not sure what you mean
how can i get w32codecs packages?
enable the medibuntu repository - then install w32codecs
thanks
